intro: Pentaraphia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
